RunData

Class ViewRunData

  • java.lang.Object
    • RunData.ViewRunData

  • public class ViewRunData
extends java.lang.Object
    This sets the actual screen for current run data and gets the information from RunCntl in order to display the correct information to the user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ViewRunData(RunCntl runCntl)
      This is the constructor that initially defines the objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getRunCntl()
      This will get the information that RunCntl obtained from the snowboard in order to implement it into the view.
      void initCustomComponents()
      This method will help to customize the design of the view run data
      void statusUpdate(CheckStatus checkStatus)
      This will get the status on battery level and other information for the top bar of the screen.
      void switchGraph()
      This will switch between the various graphs in the view.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewRunData

        public ViewRunData(RunCntl runCntl)
        This is the constructor that initially defines the objects.
        Parameters:
        runCntl - This helps with getting the functioning from runCntl.

    • Method Detail

      • initCustomComponents

        public void initCustomComponents()
        This method will help to customize the design of the view run data

      • getRunCntl

        public void getRunCntl()
        This will get the information that RunCntl obtained from the snowboard in order to implement it into the view.

      • switchGraph

        public void switchGraph()
        This will switch between the various graphs in the view. The user will be able to chose if they would like to view how they are improving in speed, distance, duration, altitude, number of falls, or G-Force.

      • statusUpdate

        public void statusUpdate(CheckStatus checkStatus)
        This will get the status on battery level and other information for the top bar of the screen.
        Parameters:
        checkStatus - This is pulled from the CheckStatus class in the PairAndStatus package.
